title.narrative: WANEP, West African Network for Peacebuilding, 2017 - 2020
WANEP, West African Network for Peacebuilding, 2017-2020

description.narrative:
Denna insats ger stöd till West Africa Network for Peacebuilding (WANEP) för att genomföra de program som nätverket bedriver i 15 länder i Västafrika under perioden 2017-2020. WANEP avser bidra till ett fredligare Västafrika genom sitt konfliktförebyggande- och fredsbyggande arbete. Nätverkets strategiska prioriteringar för perioden 2015-2020 är:
1) Bidra till ett fungerande nationellt system för tidig varning i 15 stater i Västafrika, länkat till ECOWAS system för tidig varning och respons (ECOWAS Early Warning and Response System). 2) Bygga upp medborgarnas kapacitet för fredsbyggande och konfliktprevention på lokal, nationell och regional nivå. 3) Bidra till fred och säkerhet genom att tillse att forskningsresultat används i utvecklandet av olika policies. 4) Bygga in jämställdhetsfrågorna i fredsarbetet på lokal, nationell och regional nivå. 5) Säkerställa institutionell och finansiell hållbarhet för WANEP som nätverk på regional resektive nationell nivå.
Den totala budget för WANEPs program 2017-2020 är ca 16,7 miljoner USD (150 miljoner SEK). Det svenska stödet kanaliseras genom ett samfinansieringsavtal, där Danmark och Österrike är övriga givare. Årlig budget ligger på cirka 4 miljoner USD, varav Sverige står för 24%, och JFA-givare totalt för cirka 49%. Sveriges del av JFA-stödet är 48%. Dock baseras denna uträkning på en kalkyl som inte inkluderar bidrag från varken Danmark eller Österrike under år 2020 (fortfarande ej bekräftat).
I och med denna beredning och detta beslut godkänns också WANEPs arbetsplan för 2017.
The objective of the intervention is to operationalize an integrated and decentralized early warning and response system at community, national and regional levels in West Africa.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

16.a - Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime.

16.a - Stärka berörda nationella institutioner, bland annat genom internationellt samarbete, i syfte att bygga upp kapacitet på alla nivåer, i synnerhet i utvecklingsländerna, för att förebygga våld och bekämpa terrorism och brottslighet.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

title.narrative: Agreement on core support to West Africa Network for Peacebuilding 2017-2020

description.narrative: Some of the achievements reported during 2019 is highlighted below. Strategic Objective 1 So far during the agreement period, WANEP was able to initiate six functioning Early Warning & Response Centres in the ECOWAS region, namely in Guinea Bissau, Mali, Cote d’Ivoire, Liberia, Burkina Faso. During 2019, WANEP contributed towards effective prevention of conflict and promotion of peacebuilding through its Early Warning and Response Mechanisms. WANEP and partners through a series of activities contributed to reducing hotspots in Cote d’Ivoire, Burkina Faso, Niger, Ghana, The Gambia, Liberia, Sierra Leone and Senegal, and also contributed to minimizing violence and supporting successful elections and transitions in those countries. Pre-intervention hotspots amounted to an average of 20 per country. Post intervention assessment showed a remarkable decrease and transformation. Averagely, eight high risk hotspots. ECOWARN: WANEP produced, 436 Situation Reports, 3433 Incident Reports which enhanced regional conflict analysis and recommendations in support of National Response mechanisms including established Response Centres. Strategic Objective 2 From 2015 to 2019, WANEP at regional and strategic level, has built the capacity of 514 staff of AU, ECOWAS, the UN, National institutions and CSOs. 44% of the 514 are female. Additionally 15 Female Mediators have been trained by WANEP in support of the FEMWISE initiative. At local level a network of 2885 peer mediators supporting local mediation work at the youth and school level in 11 countries of the region were trained. Under this objective in 2019, WANEP reported various outputs and results that benefited many citizens of the Region. Some of which includese, Negieria media's committment to increased conflict sensitive reportage of women’s stories towards promoting participation of women in peacebuilding and decision making, WANEP held Conflict Sensitive Reporting training for selected West African media outlets, WANEP in Nigeria organized a workshop for 80 Journalists in Abuja, Gombe and Bauchi states as part of efforts to sensitize the media in conflict sensitive reporting with special emphasis on the implementation of UNSCR 1325. WANEP availed technical and capacity building resource on Countering Violent Extremism for stakeholders for adoption and operationalization in the sahel and West Africa. As part of WANEP’s work In Preventing Violent Extremism, the organization developed and validated a curriculum that will be incorporated in school curricular in the Sahel and Nigeria. Strategic Objective 3 WANEP and GPPAC collaborated to conduct a survey on the implementation of SDG goal 16 in Ghana under the Voluntary National Reviews (VNR) on SDG 16+. Results of the survey on SDG 16 fed into the Ghana VNR process and also being used for advocacy on the implementation in Ghana and also for creating awareness on SDGs Two key publications were produced from the Voluntary National Review of the SDG16 and related goals in Ghana and Cameroun carried out in the last quarter. The two outputs emanating from this activity include: the Research report that was presented at the HLPF in July in New York and a Policy Brief jointly produced by WANEP, GPPAC and WAN-Cameroun, titled: Peaceful Societies- the orphaned SDG target?: Local progress towards SDG 16+ peaceful, just and inclusive societies and what comes next. Practice Guide on CSOs Engagement with Intergovernmental Organizations (IGOs): A publication, Practice Guide on CSOs Engagement with IGOs was released and disseminated among partners and CSOs worldwide. The Guide is a scoping of WANEP’s partnership with ECOWAS and AU and provides a deeper understanding of the engagement between WANEP and these two institutions in their collaboration in Conflict Prevention and Peacebuilding. It also provides vital lessons useful for strengthening collaboration between Civil Society and IGOs in other regions in Africa. Strategic Objective 4 WANEP in collaboration with ECOWAS conducted survey on Status of the development and implementation of NAPs on UNSRC 1325 in West Africa. The survey is contributing to the enhancement of implementation of NAPs in ECOWAS member states and also enhanced the AUs baseline and Continental Result Framework. Through the provistion of technical support to UNSCR 1325 and NAPs surveys, validations and reviews in the region, WANEP supported Ghana, Senegal and Niger enhanced NAPs development processes. Strategic Objective 5 During the year, WANEP implemented various instfitutional strengthening activities for both the regional office as well as the country offices, including financial and administrative support provided for 14 National Networks and technical support provided for 7 National Networks (Guinea, Senegal, Guinea Bissau, Ghana, Nigeria, Mali and Benin. Roadmap for the development of 2021 – 2025 Strategic Plan developed and approved by Board. Roadmap is guiding the strategy development process and has enhanced inclusivity and ownership of the strategy development process.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
